contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They filled the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land was filled with them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when Pharaoh told them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when they were told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They did not know me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was not known to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "the swarms of flies devastated the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land was ruined because of the swarms of flies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing anyone has ever seen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing ever seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that these plagues have destroyed Egypt" or "that their God has destroyed Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that Egypt is destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then Pharaoh drove Moses and Aaron out from his presence" or "Then Pharaoh had his servants drive Moses and Aaron out from his presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then Moses and Aaron were driven out from Pharaoh's presence

contextId.occurrenceNote: There were so many locusts that the land appeared to be dark. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that they darkened the land" or "so that the land appeared dark" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that it was darkened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Eat it with bread which you have made without yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Eat it with bread made without yeast

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not leave any of it until the morning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You must not let any of it be left over until morning

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "an assembly that you have set apart to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an assembly that is set apart to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will do no work on these days" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No work will be done on these days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "That must be the only work that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That must be the only work that may be done by you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "there must not be any yeast in your houses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no yeast must be found in your houses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Exodus 12:8](../12/08.md). Alternate translation: "bread which you have made without yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: bread made without yeast

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They had already tied up their kneading bowls in their clothes and on their shoulders" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their kneading bowls were already tied up in their clothes and on their shoulders

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Egyptians had driven them out of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they had been driven out of Egypt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that all the Israelites were to observe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be observed by all the Israelites

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the Israelite has bought with money" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: bought with money

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Each Israelite family must eat the food in one house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The food must be eaten in one house

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone must circumcise all his male relatives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all his male relatives must be circumcised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must not eat bread with yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No bread with yeast may be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must eat bread without yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Bread without yeast must be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You may not have any bread with yeast among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no bread with yeast may be seen among you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You may not have any yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No yeast may be seen with you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So the Israelites camped as Yahweh had instructed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So the Israelites camped as they were instructed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When someone told the king of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the king of Egypt was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh divided the waters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the waters were divided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Mud clogged their chariot wheels" or "Their chariot wheels were getting stuck in the mud" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their chariot wheels were clogged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active form. Alternate translation: "I will satisfy my desire on them" or "I will take all I want from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my desire will be satisfied on them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh lifted up his hand" or "Yahweh made a solemn promise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a hand was lifted up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where he camped with the Israelites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: where he was camped

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "You must surely put to death any person who touches the mountain" or "You must surely kill anyone who touches the mountain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever touches the mountain will surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must certainly stone or shoot him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must certainly be stoned or shot

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he must allow her father to buy her back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must let her be bought back

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must certainly execute that person" or "you must certainly kill that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that person must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that you can kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that he may die

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If anyone hits his father or mother, you must surely put him to death" or "You must surely kill anyone who hits his father or mother" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever hits his father or mother must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must kill that kidnapper" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that kidnapper must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must surely kill anyone who curses his father or his mother" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever curses his father or his mother must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "cannot get out of bed" or "has to stay in bed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is confined to his bed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must certainly punish that man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that man must surely be punished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must certainly fine the guilty man" or "the guilty man must pay a fine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the guilty man must surely be fined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must stone the ox to death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ox must surely be stoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must not eat its flesh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its flesh must not be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must acquit the ox's owner" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ox's owner must be acquitted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must also kill its owner" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: its owner also must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must kill the ox by stoning it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ox must be stoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if people knew" or "if the owner knew" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if it was known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If anyone finds a thief" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If a thief is found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if anyone strikes the thief so that he dies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if he is struck so that he dies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in an active form. Alternate translation: "you must sell him as a slave in order to pay for what he stole" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must be sold for his theft

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If they find that he still has the live animal that he stole" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If the stolen animal is found alive in his possession

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone steals it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if it is stolen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if you find the thief" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the thief is found

contextId.occurrenceNote: Only the man who is accused of stealing the animal must swear the oath. The owner of the lost animal must accept the oath that has been sworn. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the man who was caring for the animal must swear an oath before Yahweh and the owner must accept that oath" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an oath to Yahweh must be taken by them both

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But if someone stole the animal from him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But if it was stolen from him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But if a wild beast tore the animal in pieces" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If an animal was torn in pieces

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He will not have to pay for the animal that the wild beast destroyed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He will not have to pay for what was torn

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone rented the animal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the animal was hired

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh, you must completely destroy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh must be completely destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "any foreigner may rest and regain his strength" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: any foreigner may rest and be refreshed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We will obey everything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We will be obedient

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "precious stones for someone to set" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: precious stones to be set

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must make them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They must be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must attach the rings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The rings must be attached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that you may carry the table with them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that the table may be carried with them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that you may use them to pour out drink offerings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be used to pour out drink offerings

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Make the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The lampstand is to be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Make its cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers all of one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers are to be all made of one piece with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must make them as one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made as one piece with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Make the tongs and their trays of pure gold" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The tongs and their trays must be made of pure gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am showing you on the mountain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are being shown on the mountain

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Sew five curtains together to make one set, and sew the other five curtains together to make another set" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Five curtains must be joined to each other ... must also be joined to each other

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Put two bases" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: There must be two bases

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Separate these frames at the bottom, but join them at the top" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These frames must be separate at the bottom, but joined at the top

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have shown you here on this mountain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were shown on the mountain

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The curtain will separate the holy place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The curtain is to separate the holy place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must make the horns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The horns will be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must put the poles into the rings and place them on each side of the altar to carry it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The poles must be put into the rings, and the poles must be on the two sides of the altar, to carry it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have shown to you here on this mountain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you were shown on the mountain

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must place hangings ... courtyard" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: There must be hangings ... courtyard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must also attach hooks ... posts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: There must also be hooks ... posts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They must make the curtain ... fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer" or "Embroiderers must make the curtain ... fine twined linen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The curtain must be made ... fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "make all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard out of bronze" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard must be made of bronze

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "garments that you will set apart to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: garments that are set apart to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they must make it in one piece" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it must be made of one piece

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must mount them in gold settings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They must be mounted in gold settings

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must arrange the stones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The stones must be arranged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that they may attach it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that it might be attached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Aaron must wear the robe when he serves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The robe is to be on Aaron when he serves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that the bells make a sound" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that its sound can be heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Aaron must wear it on his forehead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It must be on Aaron's forehead

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Aaron must always wear the turban on his forehead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The turban must be always on his forehead

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Also take wafers without yeast and rub them with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Also take wafers without yeast rubbed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "By doing this, you will dedicate Aaron to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Aaron will then be set apart for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "burn it as an offering to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be an offering made to me by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: These garments belong to the priesthood and are not just Aaron's personal clothing. Alternate translation: "Aaron must reserve the holy garments for his sons after him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The holy garments of Aaron must also be reserved for his sons after him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They must wear the holy garments when you anoint his sons and ordain them to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are to be anointed in them and ordained to me in them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you sacrificed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that were given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one must eat it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It must not be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because you have set it apart to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because it has been set apart to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will be a burnt offering to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be an offering made to me by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My awesome presence will dedicate the tent to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the tent will be set apart for me by my glory

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were projections that looked like ox horns attached to the four corners of the altar. See how you translated "horns" in [Exodus 27:2](../27/02.md). Alternate translation: "You must make its horns" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its horns must be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you will attach to the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be attached to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. They counted only the men. Alternate translation: "Everyone you count" or "Every man you count" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Everyone who is counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must not put the anointing oil that is dedicated to Yahweh on a person's skin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It must not be applied to people's skin

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase with "blended" can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Make it into the form of incense that a perfumer has blended" or "A perfumer must blend it into a kind of incense" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Make it into the form of incense, blended by a perfumer

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for you must treat it as holy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for it must be treated by you as holy

contextId.occurrenceNote: "must surely be killed." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must surely kill" or "you must surely execute" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "which Yahweh wrote on with his own hand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: written on by his own hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active form. Alternate translation: how will people know" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: how will it be known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "but you will not see my face" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but my face will not be seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what Yahweh had commanded him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what he was commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must kill anyone who does work on that day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whoever does any work on that day must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He made them as one piece" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were made as one piece

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Bezalel attached the rings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The rings were attached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He made the cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers as one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers were all made of one piece with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he made the 3 cups look like almond blossoms" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: three cups made like almond blossoms

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "there were 4 cups which Bezalel made to look like almond blossoms" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there were four cups made like almond blossoms

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which he made as one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made as one piece with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He made the horns as one piece with the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its horns were made as one piece with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which they attached to the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be attached to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He made the horns as one piece" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The horns were made of one piece

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which they placed under the ledge" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be placed under the ledge

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Bezalel and the workers made all the hangings around the courtyard with fine linen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the hangings around the courtyard were made of fine linen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Bezalel and the workers made the bases for the posts out of bronze" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The bases for the posts were made of bronze

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They made the hooks, the rods for the posts, and the covering for the tops of the posts out of silver" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The hooks and rods for the posts were made of silver, and the covering for the tops of the posts was also made of silver

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They covered the courtyard posts with silver" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the courtyard posts were covered with silver

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They made the curtain out of" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The curtain was made of

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They made the covering for the tops of the posts and their rods out of silver" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The covering for their tops and its rods were made of silver

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They made all of the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard out of bronze" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard were made of bronze

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which Moses instructed the Levites to write down" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as it was taken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "All the gold that the people used for the project" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the gold that was used for the project

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The silver which the community gave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The silver given by the community

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they made it as one piece with the ephod with fine twisted linen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was made of one piece with the ephod, made of fine twined linen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They mounted the stones in gold settings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The stones were mounted in gold settings

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The workers arranged the stones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The stones were arranged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so they could attach it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that it might be attached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you have set apart to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are set apart to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So the people set up the tabernacle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So the tabernacle was set up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "rose up from" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was taken up from over

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when it rose up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that it was lifted up
